title: Option to buy RP based on how much money you spend
body: So with the new changes it'd be really nice to be able to choose how much you want to spend, so like you can spend just enough money to get what you want.

Could work. Some maths later and the $ to base RP rate seems to be $1=104RP (for AUS), with the exception of $35 (which could be considered an outlier), using the changed RP rates. Using that it would be reasonable to assume $14 would give you 1456RP, or about that. The problem lies with *bonus RP*. There's not any specific conversion rate in regards to bonus RP, so calculating that would be quite difficult. It's not even increased exponentially as the amount you pay increases, rather it's a bit more random.

Honestly though if something like this were to be implemented I wouldn't be surprised if it had reduced RP rates and/or no bonus RP to discourage people from using it in place of fixed value purchases.

Personally I think that every time should have a fixed USD price. 
Then Australia can pay the converted rate based on the strength of the dollar.
I have made this decision off reading the comments in the main thread. 

I also think you should be allowed to buy RP in bulk for the bonus RP, as well as just the individual items.
And there was a red post saying why this isn't the case.

There post was that it would be too confusing. 
Personally I disagree.
If someone is spending money online, the concept of conversion rates and different prices for different dollars is a basic one. 

Display the;
- RP Price
- USD Price
- Conversion Price based on selected currency. 

Then have a currency selector in the top right corner of the shop, as well a the current conversion rate displayed next to it.

>- Conversion Price based on selected currency. 

Hint: this requires an updated client.

Fact is it is complicated, and honestly, you have to take into account the twelvies that play this game.
